intro: Doliocarpus herrerae, commonly known as the Herrera's doliocarpus, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
